intro: Galium praeboreale, commonly known as the boreal bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium praeboreale is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
